description: A novel about the mysteriously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, set in the Roaring Twenties.
title: The Great Gatsby

description: A story about racial inequality and moral growth in the American South during the 1930s, told through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch.
title: To Kill a Mockingbird

description: A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of totalitarianism, mass surveillance, and repressive regimentation of people and behaviors.
A romantic novel of manners that follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet, who learns about the repercussions of hasty judgments.
title: Pride and Prejudice

description: The story of a teenager named Holden Caulfield who is struggling with adolescence and loss as he navigates his way through New York City.
title: The Catcher in the Rye

description: A fantasy novel about the journey of Bilbo Baggins, who is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor from the fearsome dragon Smaug.
title: The Hobbit

description: A dystopian novel set in a future American society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.
title: Fahrenheit 451

description: An epic high-fantasy novel that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring, which was created by the Dark Lord Sauron.
title: The Lord of the Rings

description: An allegorical novella that reflects events leading up to the Russian Revolution of 1917 and the Stalinist era of the Soviet Union.
title: Animal Farm

description: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic World State, inhabited by genetically modified citizens and an intelligence-based social hierarchy.
title: Brave New World

description: A series of fiction books written as the journals of the main character, Greg Heffley, detailing his middle school experiences.
title: The Diary of a Wimpy Kid

description: A dystopian novel set in a post-apocalyptic society where young people are selected to compete in a televised death match.
title: The Hunger Games

description: A novel about a sixteen-year-old cancer patient who meets and falls in love with another cancer patient at a support group.
title: The Fault in Our Stars

description: A series of high fantasy novels set in the fictional realm of Narnia, a fantasy world of magic, mythical beasts, and talking animals.
title: The Chronicles of Narnia

description: A comedic science fiction series beginning with the adventures of Arthur Dent, a hapless Englishman, following the demolition of Earth by the Vogons.
title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

description: The first novel in the Harry Potter series, featuring a young wizard who discovers his magical heritage on his eleventh birthday.
title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone

description: A dystopian novel set in a near-future New England, in a totalitarian state resembling a theonomy that has overthrown the United States government.
title: The Handmaid's Tale

description: A novel about an aging Cuban fisherman and his supreme ordeal: a relentless, agonizing battle with a giant marlin far out in the Gulf Stream.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

description: A novel about the friendship between two boys growing up in Kabul, Afghanistan and how their lives are affected by the tumultuous events of their country.
title: The Kite Runner

description: A novel about the friendship between two boys growing up in Kabul, Afghanistan and how their lives are affected by the tumultuous events of their country.
title: The Kite Runner
